summary: Email exchange between federal prosecutors discussing case strategy regarding a potential victim/witness, including assessment of enticement charge viability, the witness's indecision about pursuing a criminal case, and scheduling of a limited proffer session.

persons.name: Stnicki
persons.context: Author of email discussing case updates, including inability to bring enticement charge and witness's indecision about pursuing criminal case.

events.title: Meeting in California with potential victim/witness
events.description: Prosecutors met with a potential victim/witness in California; the meeting did not yield significant new information, and the witness was unsure about pursuing a criminal case.

events.title: Scheduled limited proffer session
events.description: A witness is scheduled to come in for a limited proffer to discuss her background.

keyFacts: Prosecutors determined they 'almost certainly couldn't bring an enticement charge' based on timing and location facts.
A potential victim/witness met with prosecutors but is still unsure whether she wants to pursue a criminal case.
The witness did not want to discuss specific conduct during the meeting, so no additional information was obtained.
A limited proffer session with a witness to discuss her background is scheduled for a week from the email date (November 26, 2019).
The email exchange involves coordination between federal prosecutors, indicating ongoing investigative activity in late 2019.
